citation.abstract: The early evolution of the major groups of derived non-avialan theropods is still not well understood, mainly because of their poor fossil record in the Jurassic. A well-known result of this problem is the 'temporal paradox' argument that is sometimes made against the theropod hypothesis of avian origins. Here we report on an exceptionally well-preserved small theropod specimen collected from the earliest Late Jurassic Tiaojishan Formation of western Liaoning, China. The specimen is referable to the Troodontidae, which are among the theropods most closely related to birds. This new find refutes the 'temporal paradox'1 and provides significant information on the temporal framework of theropod divergence. Furthermore, the extensive feathering of this specimen, particularly the attachment of long pennaceous feathers to the pes, sheds new light on the early evolution of feathers and demonstrates the complex distribution of skeletal and integumentary features close to the dinosaur-bird transition.
citation.title: A pre-Archaeopteryx troodontid theropod from China with long feathers on the metatarsus

wikipedia.title: Origin of birds
wikipedia.summary: The origin of birds refers to the initial stages in the evolution of birds. The scientific consensus is that birds are a group of theropod dinosaurs that evolved during the Mesozoic Era.

wikipedia.title: Paraves
wikipedia.summary: Like other theropods, early paravians were bipedal, walking on their two hind legs.

wikipedia.title: Temporal paradox (paleontology)
wikipedia.summary: The temporal paradox, or time problem is a controversial issue in the evolutionary relationships of birds.

wikipedia.title: Epidexipteryx
wikipedia.summary: Epidexipteryx ("display feather") is a genus of small paravian dinosaurs, known from one fossil specimen in the collection of the Institute of Vertebrate Paleontology and Paleoanthropology in Beijing.

wikipedia.title: Tiaojishan Formation
wikipedia.summary: The Tiaojishan Formation is a geological formation in Hebei and Liaoning, People's Republic of China, dating to the middle-late Jurassic period (Bathonian-Oxfordian stages).

wikipedia.title: Anchiornis
wikipedia.summary: Anchiornis huxleyi fossils have been found in the Tiaojishan Formation of Liaoning, China, in rocks dated to the late Jurassic period (Oxfordian age), 161.0–160.5 million years ago.

wikipedia.title: Eosinopteryx
wikipedia.summary: Eosinopteryx is an extinct genus of paravian theropod dinosaurs known the late Jurassic period of China.

wikipedia.title: Aurornis
wikipedia.summary: Aurornis is an extinct genus of theropod dinosaurs from the Jurassic period of China.

wikipedia.title: Troodontidae
wikipedia.summary: Troodontidae is a family of bird-like theropod dinosaurs. During most of the 20th century, troodontid fossils were few and scrappy and they have therefore been allied, at various times, with many dinosaurian lineages.
